definitions.definition: To display one's buttocks to, typically as a jest , insult , or protest .
examples: The hooligans mooned the riot police.
It was ill-advised of Sam to moon the photographer during the shoot.

definitions.definition: To gaze at lovingly or in adoration .
To fuss over something adoringly ; to be infatuated with someone.
examples: Sarah mooned over Sam's photograph for months.
You've been mooning after her forever; why not just ask her out?
labels: usually followed by over or after
label_groups: usually followed by over or after

definitions.definition: To expose to the rays of the Moon.
To adorn with moons or crescents .
To rise in price rapidly or suddenly.
examples: It is impractical if a currency moons and plummets often.
definitions.label_groups: cryptocurrencies , of a coin or token

main_definition: ( transitive , colloquial ) To display one's buttocks to, typically as a jest , insult , or protest .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , colloquial ) To gaze at lovingly or in adoration .
( intransitive , colloquial ) ( usually followed by over or after ) To fuss over something adoringly ; to be infatuated with someone.
( transitive ) To expose to the rays of the Moon.
( transitive ) To adorn with moons or crescents .
( cryptocurrencies , of a coin or token ) To rise in price rapidly or suddenly.
( card games ) To shoot the moon .
